availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Robinson, Jr. (Quartermaster General of Kentucky)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky merchant and Quartermaster General of Kentucky. Georgetown native. Graduated from Georgetown College in 1853. Married Mary Wheeler Robinson in 1859. Quartermaster General of Kentucky.

bibl.p: William Henry Perrin, ed., History of Fayette County, Kentucky, with an Outline Sketch of the Blue Grass Region by Robert Peter, M. D., Professor of Chemistry in the Agricultural and Mechanical College, Chemist to the State Geological Society, Etc. (Chicago, IL: O. L. Baskin and Company, 1882), p. 691. “Robinson, James Fisher, Jr., 1832-” Social Networks and Archival Context, http://socialarchive.iath.virginia.edu/ark:/99166/w6v1241s (accessed January 3, 2017). “James F. Robinson,” Find A Grave, September 30, 2012, memorial no. 98031371.
